TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hдngenden Gдrten[COLOR_REVERT] verbessern die Gesundheit der Bevцlkerung. Die entsprechende Stadt erhдlt einen zusдtzlichen Bevцlkerungspunkt. Darьber hinaus erhцhen sich die Chancen der Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]GroЯen Ingenieur[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Giardini Pensili[COLOR_REVERT] migliorano la salute nella cittа e aggiungono un punto popolazione. Inoltre, aumentano la probabilitа di generare un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Ingegnere[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jardines Colgantes[COLOR_REVERT] mejoran la salud de las ciudades propias y les aсaden un punto de poblaciуn mбs. Ademбs, incrementa las probabilidades de que en su ciudad se genere un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran ingeniero[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Three Gorges Dam project is designed to tap the power of the mighty Yangtze River, the third longest river in the world. Construction began in Hubei Province, China, in 1994, and was completed in 2012. It is 607 feet high and runs 1.4 miles, making it the largest hydroelectric dam in the world. The final cost was $26 billion dollars. [PARAGRAPH:2]Constructing a dam on the Yangtze was proposed as far back as 1919 by Sun Yat-sen, but the idea was shelved for 40 years due to a series of wars, revolutions, and other national calamities hitting China. The idea was resurrected in 1954, abandoned, resurrected again in 1963, abandoned, and so on until it was given final approval in 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]There was much debate over the project, primarily because it dislocated almost two million people, but also because of its potentially devastating environmental impact and because it has eradicated 1300 archeological sites in the area. The Chinese government has pushed the project forward despite these objections and despite the unprecedented opposition of over 30%% of the delegates to the National People's Congress, a body which usually rubber-stamps government decisions.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le barrage des Trois Gorges doit servir а exploiter l'йnergie fournie par le puissant fleuve Yangzi Jiang, le troisiиme plus long fleuve du monde. La construction a dйbutй en 1994, dans la province du Hubei, en Chine, et devrait s'achever en 2009. L'ouvrage devrait alors mesurer 182 m de haut et s'йtendre sur 2 km, ce qui en fera le plus grand barrage hydroйlectrique du monde. Le gouvernement chinois йvalue le coыt final а 30 milliards de dollars, tandis que des experts indйpendants l'estiment plus prиs de 75 milliards. [PARAGRAPH:2]La construction d'un barrage sur le Yangzi Jiang avait йtй proposйe en 1919 par Sun Yat-sen, mais l'idйe йtait restйe en suspens pendant 40 ans en raison des guerres, des rйvolutions et autres dйsastres nationaux ayant touchй la Chine. Le projet renaоt en 1954, est а nouveau abandonnй, renaоt une nouvelle fois en 1963, est de nouveau abandonnй avant d'кtre dйfinitivement approuvй en 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le projet a suscitй de nombreux dйbats : prиs de deux millions de personnes doivent кtre relogйes, son impact sur l'environnement est jugй potentiellement dйvastateur et sa construction fait disparaоtre pas moins de 1 300 sites archйologiques dans cette zone. Le gouvernement chinois a finalement adoptй ce projet, en dйpit de ces objections et de l'opposition sans prйcйdent de plus de 30 %% des reprйsentants du Congrиs national populaire, qui entйrine d'ordinaire sans discuter les dйcisions du gouvernement.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Drei-Schluchten-Staudamm wird gebaut, um den Jangtse, den grцЯten Fluss der Welt, einzudдmmen. In der chinesischen Provinz Hubei begann man 1994 mit dem Bau, der 2009 fertig gestellt werden soll. Der 180 Meter hohe und 2 Kilometer breite Damm ist der lдngste hydraulische Damm der Welt. Die chinesische Regierung schдtzt die Baukosten auf etwa 30 Milliarden Dollar. Unabhдngige Experten gehen allerdings von mindestens 75 Milliarden Dollar aus. [PARAGRAPH:2]Der Damm wurde bereits im Jahr 1919 von Sun Yat-sen vorgeschlagen. Aufgrund verschiedener Kriege, Revolutionen und anderer nationaler Schicksalsschlдge konnte die Idee allerdings 40 Jahre lang nicht verwirklicht werden. 1954 und 1963 griff man sie erneut auf, verwarf sie aber erneut. [PARAGRAPH:2]Das Projekt ist umstritten, weil etwa zwei Millionen Menschen umgesiedelt werden mьssen und 1300 historische und archдologische Stдtten unwiederbringlich zerstцrt werden. Darьber hinaus sind die Auswirkungen fьr das Цkosystem der Region nicht abzusehen. Trotz aller Bedenken und des Widerstandes innerhalb der Bevцlkerung (etwa 30%% der Abgeordneten des Nationalen Volkskongresses sind gegen den Damm) treibt die chinesische Regierung das Projekt weiter voran.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il progetto della Diga delle Tre Gole и stato realizzato per attingere dalla potenza del grande fiume Yangtze, il terzo corso d'acqua piщ grande del mondo. La costruzione cominciт nella provincia di Hubei nel 1994 in Cina e verrа completata nel 2009: al termine dei lavori, la diga sarа alta quasi 200 metri per una lunghezza di due chilometri, diventando la diga idroelettrica piщ grande del mondo. Il governo Cinese ha stimato che il costo totale dei lavori si aggirerа attorno ai 30 miliardi di dollari, mentre fonti indipendenti dicono che la cifra reale sarа di 75 milioni di dollari. [PARAGRAPH:2]La costruzione di una diga sullo Yangtze venne proposta per la prima volta nel 1919 da Sun Yat-sen, ma a causa di una serie di guerre, rivuoluzioni e altre calamitа naturali, che hanno colpito la Cina nei successivi 40 anni, il progetto venne riesumato nel 1954 per essere abbandonato e ripreso nel 1963 e cosм via fino al 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]Si и molto discusso su questo progetto, principalmente perchй la sua realizzazione prevedeva lo sfollamento di due milioni di persone, ma anche perchй puт avere un devastante impatto ambientale che distruggerа la bellezza do 1300 siti archeologici nella zona. Il governo Cinese ha mandato comunque avanti il progetto malgrado il 30%% dei delegati del Congresso Nazionalpoplare fosse contro questa opera.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El proyecto de la presa de las Tres Gargantas estб diseсado para explotar la energнa del Yangtzй, el tercer rнo mбs largo del mundo. Se empezу a construir en la provincia de Hubei, China, en 1994, y estб previsto que se acabe en el 2009. Cuando estй terminada, tendrб doscientos metros de altura y unos dos kilуmetros de largo, lo que la convertirб en la mayor presa hidroelйctrica del mundo. El gobierno chino estima que su coste final serб de unos treinta mil millones de dуlares, aunque expertos independientes lo cifran en setenta y cinco mil millones. [PARAGRAPH:2]La construcciуn de una presa en el Yangtzй ya fue propuesta en 1919 por Sun Yat-sen, pero la idea se tuvo que aparcar durante cuarenta aсos debido a una serie de guerras, revoluciones y otras calamidades nacionales que afligieron a China. La idea se recuperу en 1954, se abandonу de nuevo, se volviу a desechar en 1963 y asн sucesivamente hasta que finalmente se le dio el visto bueno en 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]El proyecto ha sido muy controvertido, bбsicamente porque desahuciarб a dos millones de personas, pero tambiйn por su impacto potencialmente devastador en el entorno y debido a que comportarб la desapariciуn de mil trescientos yacimientos arqueolуgicos en la zona. El gobierno chino ha impulsado el proyecto pese a estas objeciones y la oposiciуn sin precedentes de alrededor del 30%% de los delegados del Congreso Nacional Popular, un уrgano que suele refrendar las decisiones gubernamentales.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wat Preah Pisnulok also referred to as "Angkor Wat" is a temple in Angkor, Cambodia. Wat Preah Pisnulok was constructed in the 12th century by King Suryavaman II to serve as the royal palace and state temple, Hinduism being the state religion. Two or three centuries later Wat Preah Pisnulok was converted to Buddhist use. Wat Preah Pisnulok is a complex of buildings surrounded by a wall and then moat. The enclosed area measures 3000 feet by 2600 feet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Wat Preah Pisnulok is constructed primarily of sandstone blocks. The complex is laid out in a rectangular pattern somewhat resembling that of an ancient fortress; the inner buildings are separated from the outer walls by a courtyard similar to a bailey one might find in a castle. [PARAGRAPH:2]At one time the courtyard was filled with wooden buildings, but these have all since perished. The inner structure is split into three galleries built on raised platforms. The outer galleys once contained libraries, while the inner was a shrine to Vishnu (and has since been converted to a shrine to Buddha). The galleries are topped with towers that resemble stylized beehives, the tallest reaching about 140 feet in height. The buildings' walls are covered with ornate and beautiful bas relief sculptures depicting scenes from Hindu mythology. [PARAGRAPH:2]Though largely neglected in the latter half of the 20th century, serious efforts are now being made to preserve and restore this wonderful and unique place of worship, and pilgrims and tourists are visiting it in ever-greater numbers each year.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Angkor Vat est un temple situй а Angkor, au Cambodge. Il a йtй construit au XIIe siиcle par le roi Suryavarman II pour servir de palais royal et de temple d'Etat, l'hindouisme йtant la religion d'Etat. Deux ou trois siиcles plus tard, il est transformй en temple bouddhiste. Angkor Vat est un complexe de bвtiments d'une surface totale de 1 500 m sur 1 300 m et entourй d'un mur et de douves. [PARAGRAPH:2]Angkor Vat est construit essentiellement avec des blocs de grиs, sur un modиle rectangulaire ressemblant а celui d'une ancienne forteresse. Les bвtiments intйrieurs sont sйparйs des murs extйrieurs par une cour, similaire а la cour intйrieur que l'on pourrait trouver dans un chвteau. [PARAGRAPH:2]A l'origine, la cour contenait des bвtiments en bois mais ils ont tous disparu. La structure intйrieure est divisйe en trois galeries construites sur des terrasses surйlevйes. Les galeries extйrieures contenaient autrefois des bibliothиques tandis que celle du centre йtait un sanctuaire dйdiй а Vishnou (qui est dйsormais consacrй а Bouddha). Les galeries sont surmontйes de tours ressemblant а des ruches stylisйes, les plus grandes pouvant mesurer prиs de 43 m de haut. Les murs des bвtiments sont recouverts de sculptures comportant de magnifiques bas-reliefs richement ornйs reprйsentant des scиnes de la mythologie hindoue. [PARAGRAPH:2]Grandement nйgligй pendant la deuxiиme moitiй du XXe siиcle, de sйrieux efforts sont dйsormais entrepris pour prйserver et restaurer ce lieu de culte unique et magnifique. Chaque annйe, le nombre de visiteurs, qu'ils soient pиlerins ou touristes, ne cesse d'augmenter.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Angkor Wat ist ein Tempel im kambodschanischen Angkor. Er wurde im 12. Jahrhundert von Kцnig Suryavaman II. als Kцnigspalast und Staatstempel errichtet. Angkor Wat war zunдchst ein hinduistischer, spдter ein buddhistischer Tempel. Die Anlage besteht aus mehreren von einer Mauer und einem Graben umgebenen Gebдuden. Die Gesamtflдche der Tempelanlage betrдgt 900 mal 800 Meter.[PARAGRAPH:2]Angkor Wat wurde primдr aus Sandsteinquadern gebaut. Der rechtwinklige Gebдudekomplex erinnert an die Struktur alter Festungen, zumal die inneren Gebдude durch einen Hof von der AuЯenmauer getrennt sind.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die auf dem Hof errichteten Holzgebдude sind nicht erhalten. Angkor Wat ist in drei Galerien auf erhцhten Plattformen unterteilt. Wдhrend in den дuЯeren Galerien Bibliotheken untergebracht waren, befand sich in der inneren Galerie zunдchst ein Vishnu-, spдter ein Buddha-Schrein. Die Tьrme der Galerien erinnern an stilisierte Bienenstцcke. Der hцchste Turm ist etwa 42 Meter hoch. Die Wдnde der Gebдude sind mit Flachreliefen verziert, die Szenen der Hindumythologie darstellen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Nachdem Angkor Wat in der zweiten Hдlfte des 20. Jahrhunderts dem Verfall preisgegeben war, versucht man nun, diesen einzigartigen Ort, der Jahr fьr Jahr unzдhlige Pilger und Touristen anlockt, zu erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Angkor Wat и un tempio di Angkor in Cambogia, edificato nel XII secolo da re Suyavaman II: questa struttura era adibita a palazzo reale e tempio centrale, con l'Induismo come religione ufficiale. Due o tre secoli dopo, l'Angkor Wat venne convertito al Buddismo. Questo complesso, delle dimensioni di un chilometro per ottocentometri, ospitava molti edifici circondati da una muraglia e un fossato. [PARAGRAPH:2]Angkor Wat и costruito principalmente in pietra arenaria: il complesso и stato concepito a forma rettangolare e in qualche modo ricorda le antiche fortezze; gli edifici all'interno, sono separati dalle mura esterne da un cortile simile a quelli dei castelli. [PARAGRAPH:2]Un tempo, questo cortile ospitava degli edifici costruiti in legno che non hanno retto all'incedere della storia; la struttura interna и divisa in tre gallerie realizzate su piattaforme sopraelevate, mentre quelle esterne ospitavano biblioteche. La zona interna era un santuario dedicato a Vishnu (e successivamente riconvertito a Budda). In cima alle gallerie si trovano delle torri che ricordano la struttura degli alveari: la torre piщ alta raggiunge i 40 metri. Le mura dei palazzi sono ornate da meravigliosi bassorilievi che dipingono scene della mitologia Indщ. [PARAGRAPH:2]Malgrado sia stato trascurato a metа del XX secolo, sono stati fatti molti sforzi per riportare questo tempio ai fasti di un tempo: ogni anno il luogo viene visitato da migliaia di pellegrini e turisti.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Angkor Wat es un templo en Angkor, Camboya. Fue construido en el s. XII por el rey Suryavaman II como palacio real y templo oficial, siendo el hinduismo la religiуn del estado. Dos o tres siglos mбs tarde se adaptу para ser utilizado por los budistas. Angkor Wat es un complejo de edificios rodeados por una muralla precedida de un foso. El recinto mide 915 x 790 metros aproximadamente. [PARAGRAPH:2]Estб construido principalmente con bloques de piedra arenisca. El trazado del complejo tiene una forma rectangular que recuerda vagamente a la de una fortaleza; los edificios del interior estбn separados de la muralla exterior por un patio, de manera parecida al patio de armas que puede encontrarse en un castillo. [PARAGRAPH:2]En el pasado, el patio estaba repleto de edificios de madera, pero todos han desaparecido. La estructura interior estб dividida por tres galerнas construida sobre plataformas elevadas. Las galerнas exteriores antaсo contuvieron bibliotecas, mientras que la interior era un altar a Visnu (y ha sido convertido en uno a Buda). Las galerнas estбn coronadas por torres que parecen colmenas estilizadas, la mбs alta alcanza cuarenta y cinco metros de altura. Las paredes de los edificios estбn cubiertas con hermosos y recargados bajorrelieves que representan escenas de la mitologнa hindъ. [PARAGRAPH:2]Aunque se ha descuidado muchнsimo durante la segunda mitad del s. XX, en la actualidad se estбn haciendo grandes esfuerzos por conservar y restaurar esta maravilla y lugar ъnico de veneraciуn, y el nъmero de turistas y peregrinos que lo visitan aumenta aсo tras aсo.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wat Preah Pisnulok[COLOR_REVERT] adds an additional population point in all cities. Further, it allows Artists to be hired using Priest slots. It increases the odds of its city generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT]. The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wat Preah Pisnulok[COLOR_REVERT] requires the city to have Hinduism and also requires Hinduism or Buddhism as your state religion.
TEXT.French: Le temple d'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Angkor Vat[COLOR_REVERT] permet de transformer 3 citoyens en prкtres dans la ville oщ il est construit. Il amйliore aussi la production de tous vos prкtres. Le temple d'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Angkor Vat[COLOR_REVERT] augmente les chances d'apparition d'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]prophиte illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Angkor Wat[COLOR_REVERT] ermцglicht Ihnen in der jeweiligen Stadt die Umwandlung von 3 Bьrgern in Priester. Darьber hinaus beschleunigt es die Produktion Ihrer Priester-Spezialisten. AuЯerdem erhцht [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Angkor Wat[COLOR_REVERT] die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]GroЯen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Angkor Wat[COLOR_REVERT] permette la trasformazione di tre cittadini in sacerdoti nella cittа. Inoltre, aumenta la produzione di tutti i sacerdoti specialisti. [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Angkor Wat[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la probabilitа di generare un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Profeta[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Angkor Wat[COLOR_REVERT] permite convertir en sacerdotes a tres ciudadanos en la ciudad en la que se construya esta maravilla. Ademбs, aсade mбs producciуn a todos los sacerdotes especialistas propios. Tambiйn aumenta las probabilidades de que en su ciudad se genere un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran profeta[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Space Elevator[COLOR_REVERT] increases spaceship part production in all of your cities and increases its city's odds of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Scientist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]ascenseur de l'espace[COLOR_REVERT] augmente de 50%% la construction du vaisseau spatial dans toutes vos villes et augmente les chances d'apparition d'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]savant illustre[COLOR_REVERT] dans la ville qui l'abrite.
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Weltraumlift[COLOR_REVERT] beschleunigt die Produktion von Raumschiffteilen in Ihren Stдdten um 50%. Darьber hinaus erhцhen sich die Chancen der Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]GroЯen Wissenschaftler[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ascensore Spaziale[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la produzione di componenti dell'astronave del 50% in tutte le cittа e aumenta la probabilitа di generare un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Scienziato[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ascensor Espacial[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta en un 50%% la producciуn de las piezas para naves espaciales en todas las ciudades propias e incrementa las probabilidades de que en su ciudad se genere un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran cientнfico[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Wall[COLOR_REVERT] reduces enemy speed within your borders and also damages barbarians within your borders. It also increases the chance of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Engineer[COLOR_REVERT]. The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Wall[COLOR_REVERT] requires the city to have Confucianism or Taoism and also requires Confucianism or Taoism as your state religion.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande muraille[COLOR_REVERT] affecte la zone situйe au sein des frontiиres culturelles de son propriйtaire sur ce continent, mкme si elle se trouve physiquement en dehors de la Grande muraille. Les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]barbares[COLOR_REVERT] ne peuvent alors plus entrer dans cette zone. Le propriйtaire reзoit, quant а lui, davantage de points de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]gйnйral illustre[COLOR_REVERT] en combattant dans cette zone.
TEXT.German: Der Einflussbereich der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Großen Mauer[COLOR_REVERT] erstreckt sich über das innerhalb der kulturellen Grenzen der besitzenden Zivilisation befindliche Gebiet auf dem jeweiligen Kontinent - auch dann, wenn es sich physikalisch außerhalb der Großen Mauer befindet. Dadurch wird [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barbaren[COLOR_REVERT] der Zutritt zu diesem Territorium verwehrt und die besitzende Zivilisation gewinnt durch Kämpfe innerhalb dieses Gebiets mehr [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Großer General[COLOR_REVERT]-Punkte.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande Muraglia[COLOR_REVERT] produce effetti all'interno dei confini culturali presenti sul continente, anche su territori materialmente all'esterno della Grande Muraglia. Tali effetti si sostanziano nel fatto che i [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]barbari[COLOR_REVERT] non possono mettere piede in quei territori e che la civiltа riceve piщ punti da [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Grande Generale[COLOR_REVERT] per gli scontri combattuti all'interno dell'area.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gran muralla[COLOR_REVERT] afecta al бrea situada dentro de las fronteras culturales de su propietario en ese continente, aunque йsta se encuentre fuera de la Gran muralla. Los efectos son que los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bбrbaros[COLOR_REVERT] no pueden entrar en dicha бrea y que el propietario recibe mбs puntos de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gran general[COLOR_REVERT] por los combates que se libren en ella.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Library[COLOR_REVERT] gives its city two free scientists. It increases its city's odds of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Scientist[COLOR_REVERT]. The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Library[COLOR_REVERT] requires you to have the Pantheon civic active.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande bibliothиque[COLOR_REVERT] fait apparaоtre deux scientifiques gratuitement et amйliore ainsi la production scientifique de la ville. Elle augmente aussi nettement les chances d'apparition d'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]savant illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Hat eine Stadt eine [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]GroЯe Bibliothek[COLOR_REVERT], erhдlt sie zwei Wissenschaftsspezialisten, die den ForschungsausstoЯ der Stadt deutlich erhцhen. Ebenso deutlich erhцhen sich die Chancen der Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]GroЯen Wissenschaftler[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gran Biblioteca[COLOR_REVERT] otorga a su ciudad dos cientнficos gratis, lo que aumenta su producciуn cientнfica. Tambiйn incrementa mucho las probabilidades de que en su ciudad se genere un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran cientнfico[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Lighthouse[COLOR_REVERT] gives one additional trade route and one additional trade routes to all coastal cities. TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grand phare[COLOR_REVERT] ajoute 2 routes commerciales а toutes les villes cфtiиres et augmente les chances d'apparition d'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]marchand illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]GroЯe Leuchtturm[COLOR_REVERT] erschlieЯt zwei zusдtzliche Handelswege zu allen Kьstenstдdten. Darьber hinaus erhцhen sich durch einen [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]GroЯen Leuchtturm[COLOR_REVERT] die Chancen der Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]GroЯen Hдndler[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande Faro[COLOR_REVERT] aggiunge due rotte commerciali a tutte le cittа costiere. Il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande Faro[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la probabilitа di generare un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Mercante[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gran Faro[COLOR_REVERT] aсade dos rutas comerciales a todas las ciudades costeras. El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gran Faro[COLOR_REVERT] tambiйn aumenta las probabilidades de que en su ciudad se genere un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran mercader[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.Russian: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Cothon[COLOR_REVERT] add a bonus production to every water tile in the city in which it's constructed. It also increases the chances of a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Merchant[COLOR_REVERT] appearing. The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Cothan[COLOR_REVERT] requires you to have the Pantheon civic active.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]statues moaп[COLOR_REVERT] confиrent un bonus de production а chaque case d'eau de la ville qui les abrite. Elles augmentent йgalement les chances d'apparition d'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]prophиte illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Moai-Statuen[COLOR_REVERT] gewдhren jedem Wasser-Gelдndefeld einer Stadt einen Produktionsbonus und erhцhen die Chancen auf den Erhalt eines [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]GroЯen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statua Moai[COLOR_REVERT] dа un bonus alla produzione per ogni casella d'acqua nella cittа in cui и costruita. Aumenta inoltre le probabilitа che appaia un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Profeta[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Moai[COLOR_REVERT] aсaden una bonificaciуn a la producciуn en cada casilla de agua de la ciudad en que se construyan. Tambiйn aumentan las posibilidades de que aparezca un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]gran profeta[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grand Canal[COLOR_REVERT] adds extra commerce to all river tiles in your city. The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grand Canal[COLOR_REVERT] requires the city to have Confucianism or Taoism and also requires Confucianism or Taoism as your state religion.

TEXT.English: Lubyanka
TEXT.German: Lubyanka

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The Lubyanka is the popular name for the headquarters of the KGB and affiliated prison on Lubyanka Square in Moscow. It is a large building with a facade of yellow brick, designed by Alexander V. Ivanov in 1897 and augmented by Aleksey Shchusev in 1940-1947.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The Lubyanka was originally built in 1898 as the Neo-Baroque headquarters of the All-Russia Insurance Company, noted for its beautiful parquet floors and pale green walls. Belying its massiveness, the edifice avoids an impression of heroic scale: isolated Palladian and Baroque details, such as the minute pediments over the corner bays and the central loggia, are lost in an endlessly-repeating classicizing palace facade, where three bands of cornices emphasize the horizontal lines. A clock is centered in the uppermost band of the facade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Following the Bolshevik Revolution, the structure was seized by the government for the headquarters of the secret police, then called the Cheka. In Soviet Russian jokes it was referred to as the tallest building in Moscow, since Siberia could be seen from its basement. Another joke referred to the building as "Adult's World" as compared to "Children's World," the name of the popular toy store across the street.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]During the Great Purge, the offices became increasingly cramped due to staff numbers. In 1940, the most famous Soviet architect, Shchusev, was commissioned to double its size by adding another storey and engulfing backstreet buildings. Shchusev's design accentuated Neo-Renaissance detailing, but only the left part of the facade was reconstructed under his direction in the 1940s, due to the war and other hindrances. This asymmetric facade survived intact until 1983, when the symmetry was restored at the urging of Yuri Andropov in accordance with Shchusev's plans.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Although the Soviet secret police changed its name many times, its headquarters remained in this building. Secret police chiefs from Lavrenty Beria to Yuri Andropov used the same office on the third floor, which looked down on the statue of Cheka founder Felix Dzerzhinsky. A prison at the ground floor of the building figures prominently in Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's classic study of the Soviet police state, The Gulag Archipelago. Famous inmates held, tortured and interrogated there include Sidney Reilly, Raoul Wallenberg, János Esterházy and Father Walter Ciszek, S.J.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]After the dissolution of the KGB, the Lubyanka became the headquarters of the Border Guard Service of Russia, and houses the Lubyanka prison and one directorate of the Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation (FSB). In addition a museum of the KGB was opened to the public. On November 11, 1999 a fire broke out in the Lubyanka. Four FSB agents were injured, but damage was relatively mild. The fire was later traced to faulty wiring.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lubyanka[COLOR_REVERT] adds additional espionage to all of your specialists. It also increases its city's odds of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Spy[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Great prophets can create great works like great artists.
